docs.lead_paragraph: DALLAS, March 25 Declaring that "it is time we take control of Federal regulations in America," President Carter today outlined his proposals "to reduce, to rationalize and to streamline the regulatory burden throughout American life."

headline.main: PRESIDENT OUTLINES PROGRAM TO REVISE REGULATORY SYSTEM; CONGRESS TO GET PLAN TODAY In Speech to Broadcasters' Group Carter Says Reform Effort Is 'Call for Common Sense'

docs.abstract: flies to Dallas to address Natl Assn of Broadcasters conv
docs.snippet: DALLAS, March 25 Declaring that "it is time we take control of Federal regulations in America," President Carter today outlined his proposals "to reduce, to rationalize and to streamline the regulatory burden throughout American life."

byline.original: By STEVEN RATTNER Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: Sometimes a simple question put by a layman can get to the heart of a complex scientific problem more surely than expert interrogation.
docs.abstract: William E Burrows article on controversy over cancer-preventive measures; repts that majority of those in cancer research believe that environmentally caused cancer is result of dose-response relationship; notes, however, that scientific findings increasingly clash with cost-benefit considerations when 'acceptable' human risk levels for carcinogens are being formulated; illus (L)
docs.snippet: Sometimes a simple question put by a layman can get to the heart of a complex scientific problem more surely than expert interrogation.

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 22 President Carter plans a statement in the next few days endorsing regulatory revision and legislation aimed at streamlining the revision process, Administration officials said today.

headline.main: Proposals on Regulatory Policies Are Expected From Carter Soon; Key Areas Cited Copies of Act Circulated Regulation and Hospitals

docs.abstract: Pres Carter is expected to offer his proposals for streamlining regulatory process within next few days (M)
docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 22 President Carter plans a statement in the next few days endorsing regulatory revision and legislation aimed at streamlining the revision process, Administration officials said today.

byline.original: By STEVEN RATTNER Special to The New York Times
